item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 7:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Helix: Why (And How) I Use It (29 points | 23 comments)
2. Majjit LSP (45 points | 15 comments)
3. 3 shell scripts to improve your writing, or "My Ph.D. advisor rewrote himself in bash." (46 points | 18 comments)
4. SCCS roach motel (13 points | 1 comment)
5. Less talk, more code (14 points | 8 comments)
6. When Your Webcam Doesn’t Work: Solving Firefox and PipeWire Issues (11 points | 3 comments)
7. The Jujutsu version control system (61 points | 39 comments)
8. Garbage Collected Smart Pointers in Rust via Concurrent Cycle Collection (5 points | 3 comments)
9. Auth bypass in Go SSH package (12 points | 6 comments)
10. Algorithms for high performance terminal apps (9 points | no comments)
11. WebTransport (WebSockets 2.0) talk at RubyConf (4 points | 1 comment)
12. Ki, a multi-cursor structural editor (8 points | 2 comments)
13. "Rules" that terminal programs follow (52 points | 37 comments)
14. A new video captures a remarkable 1968 demo of IBM’s Executive Terminal (10 points | no comments)
15. Security Review for Mullvad VPN (1 points | no comments)
16. Oxidised causal inference in software design (2 points | 2 comments)
17. C++ exception performance three years later (14 points | no comments)
18. markitdown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (2 points | no comments)
19. The Humble For Loop in Rust (16 points | 9 comments)
20. When should we require that firmware be free? (12 points | no comments)
21. Programmers want flow. when programming, light turns RED (13 points | 11 comments)
22. What are you doing this weekend? (4 points | 10 comments)
23. Cursor Size Problems In Wayland, Explained (28 points | 1 comment)
24. Rust's incremental compiler architecture (12 points | no comments)
25. NonStop discussion around adding Rust to Git (39 points | 54 comments)
